div.p:
My brother having
recievedreceived the Appoint-
ment of consul at
Fernando Po is
naturally desirous
of visiting his
family in Boston
America, and
would be glad if
an arrangement
could be made
with an American
publisher while he is
within call. I suppose
his wife might be
made his agent in
his absence but
I don't know about
the agreement with
a publisher. So
I write to you in
order that if you
can do anything
in the matter you
may tell us.

I am getting on very
well I think. My
brother's journal
is interesting from
its being first
impressions and
I see that he has
caught many things
said by the natives
which I translated
for him at the
moment and I
think they give a
better idea of what
they do actually
say & think than
what is given by
some others.
However you will be
better able to judge
Mr & Mrs Webb help to
no mean extent in
copying - Captain
Need is at the drawings
and altogether I can
report satisfactory
progress. If you
can manage the
first proposition of
this please tell my
brother at your con-
venience - & oblige
Yours ever

His address is Hadleigh House
Highbury New Park
